title: Definitions
body: User notes:About this chapter: Codes, by their very nature, are technical documents. Every word, term and punctuation mark can add to or change the meaning of a technical requirement. It is necessary to maintain a consensus on the specific meaning of each term contained in the code. Chapter 2 performs this function by stating clearly what specific terms mean for the purpose of the code.

title: General
body: See Chapter 2 for defined terms.UpCodes note: The Chapter 2 referred to here is from the Oregon Structural Specialty Code (OSSC).
